intro: Persica domestica var. fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant peach. This variety is characterized by its sweet, aromatic fruits that develop from showy, pink to white flowers. The plant is a deciduous tree with alternate, ovate leaves that turn yellow in autumn. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. The flowers and fruits are both attractive and valuable for ornamental and culinary purposes.
